description: Template for tropical/alternative feed ingredients expansion - Phase 4.6
validation_notes: All values must comply with Phase 2 NutritionalDataValidator rules

template.name: [REQUIRED] Ingredient Common Name
template.standardized_name: [OPTIONAL] Standardized reference name if from NRC/CVB/INRA
template.separation_notes: [OPTIONAL] Notes on why similar ingredients were kept separate

minerals.available_phosphorus: [REQUIRED] g/kg (bioavailable fraction, ~40% of total if unknown)
minerals.phytate_phosphorus: [OPTIONAL] g/kg (bound fraction, ~30% of total if unknown)

energy.ne_pig: [PREFERRED for pigs] kcal/kg net energy (NRC 2012 standard)
energy.me_finishing_pig: [OPTIONAL] kcal/kg if different from growing pig

amino_acids_sid._note: Standardized Ileal Digestible values - typically ~85% of total for plant proteins

anti_nutritional_factors._note: CRITICAL for tropical ingredients - many have high ANF content
anti_nutritional_factors.trypsin_inhibitor_tu_g: [OPTIONAL] Protease inhibitor - if >40 TU/g, require heat treatment
anti_nutritional_factors.oxalates_ppm: [OPTIONAL] Calcium binder - high in some leafy greens
anti_nutritional_factors.cyanogenic_glycosides_ppm: [CRITICAL for cassava] Cyanide precursor - must be processed if >50 ppm

max_inclusion_json._note: Detailed per-animal-category limits - replaces simple max_inclusion_pct
max_inclusion_json.default: [FALLBACK] Max % if animal type not specified

safety_and_regulatory.warning: [OPTIONAL] Safety warning - e.g., 'High cyanide - must be processed', 'Limit to 10% due to gossypol'
safety_and_regulatory.regulatory_note: [OPTIONAL] Legal restrictions - e.g., 'EU: Max 15% in pig diets (Reg. EC 1831/2003)'

metadata.price_kg: [OPTIONAL] Default price in NGN per kg
metadata.notes: [OPTIONAL] Processing recommendations, regional availability, sourcing tips
metadata.region: [NEW FIELD] Africa | Asia | Europe | Americas | Oceania | Global

example_azolla.name: Azolla (Azolla pinnata)
example_azolla.separation_notes: Aquatic fern used fresh or dried - highly requested by Nigerian users

safety_and_regulatory.warning: High moisture content when fresh - dry before long-term storage

metadata.notes: Aquatic fern cultivated in ponds. Fast-growing (doubles biomass every 2-3 days). Rich in protein and minerals. Popular in Nigeria, India, and Southeast Asia for fish and poultry feed. Can be fed fresh or dried. Processing: harvest, wash, drain, sun-dry or feed fresh within 24 hours.

validation_checklist: ✅ Proximate analysis (CP + CF + fat + ash + moisture) ≤ 110% (allow 10% margin for measurement error)
✅ Energy values realistic for ingredient type (plant: 1500-3500 kcal/kg, animal: 3000-4500 kcal/kg)
✅ Calcium:Phosphorus ratio between 1:1 and 6:1 (avoid severe imbalances)
✅ If cyanogenic glycosides >50 ppm → warning + processing notes present
✅ If trypsin inhibitor >40 TU/g → heat treatment note present
✅ Amino acid SID values ~80-90% of total values (digestibility)
✅ Data source documented in standard_reference or notes
✅ Max inclusion limits set if ingredient has known toxicity/ANF issues

tier_1_standards: NRC 2012 - Nutrient Requirements of Swine (11th ed.)
NRC 1994 - Nutrient Requirements of Poultry (9th ed.)
tier_2_regional: IITA - International Institute of Tropical Agriculture
Feedipedia - Animal Feed Resources Information System
FAO - Food and Agriculture Organization tropical feed data
